articles.author: Sam Tonkin
articles.title: The out-of-control rockets and spacecraft that could become deadly - Daily Mail
articles.description: The European Space Agency estimates there is more than 10,800 tonnes of space junk currently orbiting the Earth. MailOnline takes a look at the biggest debris and when it could come down.
articles.content:
Just last week a dead NASA satellite crashed back to Earth amid warnings it had a one in 2,500 chance of killing someone.
As it was, the spacecraft smashed harmlessly into the Sahara Desert somewher… [+10064 chars]
